Configurator.reg1: Your registration key is generated based on the user name (Login) and serial number of the SPECIFIED physical disk. This means that the plugin does not need to be on the specified physical disk - enough that this disk is in the system while the plugin is running!
Configurator.reg2: For example: you can connect a removable disk or a USB flash drive to your computer. Selecting it in the list (and, accordingly, entering the user name), you will receive a unique registration key, tied to this flash drive. Now your paid functions purchased for this key will work on ANY COMPUTER if you have the desired removable disk or flash drive (and, accordingly, with the same user name). You only need to run the configurator and specify the physical disk in the list
Configurator.reg3: Your registration key is generated based on the user name and the number of your Google account. For the program to be able to obtain the number of your Google account, you must allow access to the main information of your account by clicking the "Bind" button. Your data (mail and password) are not transmitted anywhere and are not saved anywhere!
Configurator.reg4: As with the case of a hard drive binding, you can use the functions you purchased on ANY computer! It is enough just to bind to your Google account!

mpTxtNumCopy.Description: Copies the selected text or block with an attribute containing a numeric value, changing the value to a specified numerical step
mpTxtNumCopy.FullDescription: Copies the selected single line or multiline text, a block with an attribute or a multileader containing a digital value, with a value change to a specified numerical step. There are various settings - adding a prefix/suffix, suppressing tail zeros, etc.

mpTxtNumCopy.h10: Removal from number all tail zeros

mpMultiCopy.Description: Multiple copies of selected primitives with a certain step
mpMultiCopy.FullDescription:
The function supports two types of copying:
markup - copies primitives with a specified distance between them along the specified line;
divide - copies primitives by dividing the specified line by the number of segments entered.
There is a possibility to select an entity (line, polyline, spline) to set the copy path.
mpMultiCopy.msg3: Enter the number of segments or [Mark]
mpMultiCopy.msg5: Select a line, a polyline, or a spline:

mpMultiScale.Description: Function allows you to scale each of the selected objects relative to themselves
mpMultiScale.FullDescription: Each selected entity will be scaled relative to the specified point - Left Bottom, Right Bottom, Left Top, Right Top or Center. The scale point is determined by the rectangle describing the entity (Bounding Box)

mpRotAtt.Description: Function is used to change the rotation angle of attributes in the selected blocks

mpLayerAuto.Description: Function is used to automatically add a layer to the created objects (dimensions, text, multileaders, hatch, tables, viewports)
mpLayerAuto.FullDescription: The function processes the creation, copying, pasting and other commands when working with AutoCAD objects - dimensions, text, multileaders, hatching, tables, viewports - and sets the layer specified in the function settings for them. There is an option to specify the specified layers for the selected objects
mpLayerAuto.h3: Other settings are available in the full version
mpLayerAuto.h12: The function of the function is based on the processing of the command completion event. However, not all commands create new objects and can also cause errors when working with this function. You can edit the list of excluding yourself

mpFormats.Description: Function of inserting in the drawing formats according to GOST 2.301-68
mpFormats.FullDescription: Formats are inserted in the form of a block with a special label in the extended data. A label in the extended data is required to define the formats with other functions (for example, "Sheet Numbering"). Therefore, you should not insert the formats with standard means of inserting a block into AutoCAD. The function allows you to add stamps to the format - for this you need to install and at least once started the function "Stamps"

mpProductInsert.Description: The function of inserting products from the ModPlus database as blocks containing extended data
mpProductInsert.FullDescription: The function creates AutoCAD blocks based on data from the plugin database. Extended data is added to the blocks, which allows processing these blocks with other functions and creating a specification based on them\nThe function also allows you to add extended data to ordinary AutoCAD entities\nImportant! Blocks must be inserted with this function or copy already inserted, otherwise (when inserted by normal means AutoCAD), extended data will not be added!

mpProductInsert.h39: The insertion options "By two points" and "In the form of polyline" are only available for linear products (products whose length is required). The insertion option will use if it is active and selected. When using either of the two options, you do not need to pre-specify the length of the product in the window. The "By two point" insert option is available when you select the "Side view" or "Top view" display option. The insertion option "In the form of polyline" is available when selecting the "Front view (section)" display option

mpDwgBase.r1: The default function assumes that the blocks added to the local (user) database will be added to the global database that is available to all users.
mpDwgBase.r2: Therefore, try to follow the recommendations:
mpDwgBase.r3: The added block should be useful in the work. No matter what professional orientation it will be
mpDwgBase.r4: Do not use a wide variety of layers in the blocks, if this is not necessary. The best option is to use the standard layers of the ModPlus plugin
mpDwgBase.r5: If the block is dynamic, then perhaps it is not necessary to add attributes for the specification
mpDwgBase.r6: Let the blocks understandable names and descriptions, so that the user does not have to guess what it is and why
mpDwgBase.r7: If you took a block from some resource, then be sure to specify the source!
mpDwgBase.r8: Do not be lazy to think over the path to the block in the database
mpDwgBase.r9: Also on the files with blocks are imposed restrictions, namely - all the added drawings with blocks should be saved in the version of AutoCAD 2013
mpDwgBase.r10: The default function assumes that the drawings added to the local (user) database will be added to the global database, which is accessible to all users.
mpDwgBase.r11: Therefore, some restrictions are added to the attached drawings:
mpDwgBase.r12: The drawings that are added to the database must be saved in AutoCAD 2013
mpDwgBase.r13: In the attached drawing, Proxy primitives should not be used
mpDwgBase.r14: Drawings made in poor quality (for example, with multileaders from lines and text, etc.) will not be taken to the public database
mpDwgBase.r15: Also try to follow the recommendations:
mpDwgBase.r16: Do not use a wide variety of layers in the drawings, if this is not necessary. The best option is to use the standard layers of the ModPlus plugin
mpDwgBase.r17: Do not use a large number of annotation styles in your drawings. The best option is to use the annotations styles of the ModPlus plugin
mpDwgBase.r18: Do not use line types in drawings that are not standard for AutoCAD
mpDwgBase.r19: Do not use fonts that are not part of the standard AutoCAD font set in drawings
mpDwgBase.r20: If you took a drawing from some resource, then be sure to specify the source!
mpDwgBase.r21: Do not be lazy to think over the way to the drawing in the database
mpDwgBase.pp1: It is assumed that you have selected a block in a file that is not yet located in the ModPlus/Data/DwgBase directory. Therefore, you must either specify a file previously created in the ModPlus/Data/DwgBase directory to place blocks in it, or create this file. The selected block will be copied to the specified file.
mpDwgBase.pp2: If you add several blocks with a common orientation (for example, blocks of floor slabs), then create one file for them. You do not need to create a separate file for each block!
mpDwgBase.pp3: Files in the root of the ModPlus/Data/DwgBase folder can not be created! Create subfolders in it (for example, ModPlus/Data/DwgBase/Floor slabs).
mpDwgBase.pp4: If you created a file with blocks, put it in the folder DwgBase and now add blocks from the file to the database, check the "Current file" check box.
mpDwgBase.pp5: The field is filled in according to your wish
mpDwgBase.pp6: P.S. We are very happy for you, if you have an original and beautiful Nick, but try all the same to write Surname and First Name
mpDwgBase.pp7: If you are not the author of the block, then indicate the source from where this block was taken, so as not to offend its creator
mpDwgBase.pp8: The conditional path to the block in the directory that forms the structure of the tree

ostViewIn3D.Description: Cuts the selected elements in the view cube, with the possibility of specifying the size of the view cube
ostViewIn3D.FullDescription: It is possible to dynamically change the dimensions of the view cubes uniformly in all directions relative to the selected elements

mmRebarSolidAndVisible.Description2: Settings options for the selection of elements containing reinforcement for functions

mprNestedFamilyParamsTransfer.Description: Function allows you to simplify the work of establishing a associating between the parameters of nested families with the parameters of the parent family
mprNestedFamilyParamsTransfer.FullDescription: Using the function, you can create new parameters in the parent family based on one or more parameters of nested families. There is a possibility to set a mask for the name of the created parameter by adding a prefix or suffix. The function also allows you to set and delete a link to existing parameters of the parent family

mprWallsReinforcement.Description: Analysis, grouping and reinforcement according to given conditions of walls and openings
mprWallsReinforcement.FullDescription: The function works only with walls located in one level. The function analyzes the walls, allowing you to find three types of intersections (corner, end and cross) and openings. Flexible grouping allows you to specify exactly what type of reinforcement should be made. You can perform reinforcement only for the specified groups - walls, intersections or openings. The function can work even on an empty template

mprWallsReinforcement.t44: Î± is a coefficient that takes into account the effect on the anchoring length of the stress state of concrete and reinforcement and the structural solution of the element in the anchoring zone. When anchoring rods of a periodic profile with straight ends (straight anchoring) or smooth reinforcement with hooks or loops without additional anchoring devices for stretched rods, take Î± = 1.0, and for compressed ones - Î± = 0.75.
mprWallsReinforcement.t45: According to paragraph 10.3.8 of SP 63.13330.2012, the vertical bars take no more than 2t and 400 mm (t is the thickness of the wall). The maximum allowable value is calculated based on the smallest wall thickness in the group

mrBatchSheetExport.Description: The function allows you to export all specified sheets to dwg/dxf
mrBatchSheetExport.t4: If the check mark is not set and there will be files with the same name in the destination folder, then the suffix will be added to the name of the sheet being exported

mrBatchSheetExport.m2: Before exporting sheets, it is strongly recommended to save the project!\nSave the project?

mmOrderMarking.Description: Adding numbering to the mark of elements with the possibility of marking in the schedules
mmOrderMarking.FullDescription: When working in a view that is not a schedule view, the Function adds a numbered mark in the order in which the elements are created. When working in the schedule view, the Function adds a numbered mark in the order of the elements in the schedule (taking into account sorting). It is possible to set the prefix and suffix for the mark
mmOrderMarking.t1: The work of the function is possible only in the schedule in the sorting settings of which the property "Itemize every instance" is checked
mmOrderMarking.m2: No items on current view schedule
mmOrderMarking.d2: Left to right and top to bottom
mmOrderMarking.d3: Left to right and bottom to top
mmOrderMarking.d4: Right to left and top to bottom
mmOrderMarking.d5: Right to left and bottom to top

mprSheetRenumber.Description: The function allows to renumber sheets in the project
mprSheetRenumber.FullDescription: Renumbering of sheets is carried out within one group of sheets. You can display all sheets by analogy with the current settings of the project manager or display all sheets in one group. There is an opportunity to change the position of sheets by moving them in the group, while maintaining the initial numbering of sheets in this group

mprSheetRenumber.m2: Available in the full version of the function

mprSheetRenumber.h11: Start numbering from the selected sheet in the group
mprSheetRenumber.h12: Disable display results of intermediate renumbering
mprSheetRenumber.h13: Enable display results of intermediate renumbering
mprSheetRenumber.h15: Renumber sheets in a group according to the specified settings
mprSheetRenumber.h16: Renumbering by moving allows you to swap sheets in the group, while maintaining the original numbering in the group
